nodes.bodyText: nit: I think a better name would be RangerCloudIdentityService
it looks like you want to do this by env crn instead of cluster crn. You should change the path and the parameter name. see getByEnvCrn method above for comparison.
why is this the only API that needs retrying?

Refresh specifically might need retrying because another refresh is occurring. Though I've found that there is automatic retry of failed api calls, so I don' think a retry here is necessary anymore. I've removed it.

The AzureObjectId belongs in the UmsUsersState, not the UsersState because it's information that is provided by the UMS with no matching information from the FreeIPA side. We use equality to compare the FmsUser and FmsGroup models generated by the UMS against those generated by FreeIPA. Adding in asymmetric information will break the equality and the state difference calculation.
see how we handle workload credentials instead. I think that you can pass the List into the handleUser method and store it there. This will also let you only store OIDs for users that have access to the environment instead of all users.
Thanks, I've moved cloud identify information into the UmsUserState.

FmsGroups suffer the same issue as FmsUsers.
you'll need to calculate the group mapping somewhere around line 71 and add it into the UmsUsersState somewhere around line 78
These maps should just be stored in the UmsUsersState directly.
see comment on UmsUsersStateProvider for why we can't store this info in this model
see comment on UmsUsersStateProvider for why we can't store this info in this model
Maybe you could include the cluster-cm module and move all the CM related code there and use it from Data Lake.

Do you mind if we look at this in a follow up task? Moving the logic into cluster-cm is straight forward, but pulling in cluster-cm as dependency seems problematic. I ran into dependency conflicts (hibernate, CachingConfig) as well as it requiring additional dependencies (I think it required bringing an implementation of CloudbreakEventService). The  refactoring required might be beyond the scope of this task. I can file a ticket to see if the CM portion can be easily be moved into cluster-cm and client-cm.
Note: we need to add cluster proxy URL in CBD and helm-charts as well

nodes.bodyText: instead of logging when empty we should log sdxclusters we will sync, so the if won't be necessary
I think you should use a more specific exception here, and might log it
I've added a new exception type.
could be refaactored into a separate method
why 20sec? I think we use 1 min in CB for this
The cm module have these already configured to use proxy and direct connections, I think that should be used instead of creating new CM related code in other modules.
I think we used 20 seconds in thunderhead repo. I've updated this to 60 sec. As mentioned in previous comment, I think it makes sense to move the logic into other modules as a separate ticket.
why this version? in CB we use 31 or 40. I think this should be in sync
Updated to 31

altogether it would be nice if you could use https://github.com/hortonworks/cloudbreak/blob/master/client-cm/src/main/java/com/sequenceiq/cloudbreak/cm/client/ClouderaManagerApiClientProvider.java instead of this class
As mentioned in previous comment, can we look into this as a separate ticket.
please don't use in middle of method return
isn't already there a general solution for this @horadla23 ?
there is, last week we introduced @InternalOnly annotation, that should be used here instead of @DisabledCheckPermissions (I need to update authz readme)
and @InternalOnly will guarantee that the method can be called only by internal actor
Thanks, I've switched the new annotation.
unnecessary comment
this might be debug if we really need it
I think some annotations are missing here, like ignore unknown etc
For now both of these fields are required. I think once we add support for other cloud providers we might want to loosen that requirement.
implement toString please
Thanks! (I don't think I saw similar annotations in the other sdx requets)
this could be private
this is still valid
Sorry thought I made it private, fixed now.
this should go into an else branch, maybe into a separate method

this adds cloud identities for all users, regardless of if they have access to the environment. Is this desirable? I would think that you would only care about users that have access to the environment. Imagine if an account has 1000 user but the environment only has 100. You would be syncing the other 900 users cloud identities.
You can filter this map by the users that are in the umsUsersState.getUserState().getUsers()
Good point, I've added the filtering part. Also I've moved most of this logic out of UserSyncService and into CloudIdentitySyncService.
nit: if you reverse the order of conditions and inline the entitlement check here, then we can skip the entitlement check if it's not a full sync.
nice one
usually method with boolean return value start with is. eg: isCloudIdMappingSupported

this looks like a synchronous call to me, so DL service will wait until it's finished. But if I check the chain it looks like to me, this whole call from freeipa is synchronous, so freeipa will also hang until this returns. I don't think this is a good idea. Somewhere it should bbe converted to async. Most probably around RangerCloudIdentityService#setAzureCloudIdentityMapping
Good point, it might be better to do role refresh in a flow.

This just triggers role refresh, it doesn't wait around for the role refresh to succeed, so fms won't hang. I somewhat described this in the commit description. So in a follow up commit we'll want to take the ApiCommand response and poll the status of the command. So the async part will come in a follow up commit (I've discussed with Mark and David and we weren't considering using flow, but maybe we should).

The actual activity is tracked in CM. I don't think we even need a poller in the datalake service and can just let the FMS poll the datalake service. We can add a poller if we have a use-case where the datalake service needs to push the completion status to another service.
should be reversed: RANGER_USER_SYNC_ROLE_TYPE.equals(apiRole.getType())
log would be nice here
log would be nice here
there is no exception mapper for this. is it on purpose?
So the semantics of the exception might change once we add polling of the refresh command in follow on commit. So I think we can hold off on an exception mapper until then.
@NotNull is missing for both fields based on your comment
@ValidCrn for envCrn and @NotNull and @Valid for SetRangerCloudIdentityMappingRequest
log before this would be nice
we should log here with the request
some log here and in getOptionalAzureObjectId might be useful to investigate if something is not as desired

shouldn't we handle this exception somewhere? or is it ok if UserSyncService#internalSynchronizeStack handles it?
cc @handavid
good point. I think we can expand the try block up on line 50 to start on line 42 instead. That will catch this exception and register a warning.
I don't think we need to fail super cleanly in this situation. This is a very unexpected scenario.
That said, I've taken David's advice.
I think we should have an env var to enable and disable the entitlement. See a couple of lines above.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -531,6 +533,7 @@ public void getAccount(GetAccountRequest request, StreamObserver<GetAccountRespo
                                 .setWorkloadSubdomain(ACCOUNT_SUBDOMAIN)
                                 .addEntitlements(createEntitlement(CDP_AZURE))
                                 .addEntitlements(createEntitlement(CDP_AUTOMATIC_USERSYNC_POLLER))
+                                .addEntitlements(createEntitlement(CDP_CLOUD_IDENTITY_MAPPING))
